meanings.sent1: She impersonalized the situation by focusing only on the facts.
meanings.sent2: The company policy impersonalized the customer service experience.
meanings.sent3: He impersonalized the office gossip by turning it into a dry report.
meanings.sent4: The artist impersonalized the portrait, removing all personal details.
meanings.sent5: The teacher impersonalized the feedback to keep it objective and fair.

meanings.sent1: The algorithm impersonalized the decision-making process.
meanings.sent2: The new uniform policy impersonalized the employees' appearance.
meanings.sent3: She impersonalized her emotions to avoid getting hurt.
meanings.sent4: The technology impersonalized the communication between people.
meanings.sent5: The medication impersonalized his personality, making him seem distant.
